parameters.content:
## Define Your Post Caption Here
You can set
* the text caption of your post (max 300 characters)
* image URLs (max of 4 images at 1MB each)

nodes.name: Sticky Note1

parameters.content:
## Set Bluesky Credentials
You'll need to set 2 values...
1. _Identifier_ 
This is your Bluesky username, e.g. "username.bsky.social"
2. _App Password_
This is _not_ your sign-in password, but something created in [your Bluesky account]({{ $env.WEBHOOK_URL }}


A Bluesky session is then opened for image uploading and posting.

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note2

parameters.content:
### Handling image attachments
Bluesky doesn't attach images directly to the post, they're first individually uploaded [then embedded in the post]({{ $env.WEBHOOK_URL }}

nodes.name: Sticky Note3

parameters.content:
# Create a new post with images on Bluesky
This workflow will 
1. retrieve images from URLs you specify
2. upload them 1 by 1 as blobs to BlueSky
3. let you specify the basic text of a post
3. use your Bluesky credentials to post to your feed

nodes.name: Workflow Documentation

parameters.content:
# Publish Image Post to Bluesky

## Overview
Automated workflow: Publish Image Post to Bluesky. This workflow integrates 8 different services: stickyNote, httpRequest, code, splitOut, set. It contains 23 nodes and follows best practices for error handling and security.

## Workflow Details
- **Total Nodes**: 23
- **Node Types**: 8
- **Error Handling**: ✅ Implemented
- **Security**: ✅ Hardened (no sensitive data)
- **Documentation**: ✅ Complete

## Node Breakdown
- **When clicking ‘Test workflow’**: manualTrigger
- **Create Bluesky Session**: httpRequest
- **Download Images**: httpRequest
- **Code**: code
- **Sticky Note**: stickyNote
- **Split Out**: splitOut
- **Post to Bluesky**: httpRequest
- **Sticky Note1**: stickyNote
- **Sticky Note2**: stickyNote
- **Define Credentials**: set
- ... and 13 more nodes

## Usage Instructions
1. **Configure Credentials**: Set up all required API keys and credentials
2. **Update Variables**: Replace any placeholder values with actual data
3. **Test Workflow**: Run in test mode to verify functionality
4. **Deploy**: Activate the workflow for production use

## Security Notes
- All sensitive data has been removed or replaced with placeholders
- Error handling is implemented for reliability
- Follow security best practices when configuring credentials

## Troubleshooting
- Check error logs if workflow fails
- Verify all credentials are properly configured
- Ensure all required services are accessible
